Class Quadrilateral

  • java.lang.Object
    • Quadrilateral

  • public class Quadrilateral
extends java.lang.Object

    This is the Quadrilateral program

    The Quadrilateral program generates Quadrilateral objects. The fields are not private because the data is not in need of protection.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Quadrilateral(double x_a, double y_a, double x_b, double y_b, double x_c, double y_c, double x_d, double y_d)
      Constructor to be used to make quadrilateral objects, assuming the points are in order/counter-clockwise around the quadrilateral.

                     double y_a,
                     double x_b,
                     double y_b,
                     double x_c,
                     double y_c,
                     double x_d,
                     double y_d)
        Constructor to be used to make quadrilateral objects, assuming the points are in order/counter-clockwise around the quadrilateral.
        Parameters:
        x_a - first x value of a quadrilateral
        y_a - first y value of a quadrilateral
        x_b - second x value of a quadrilateral
        y_b - second y value of a quadrilateral
        x_c - third x value of a quadrilateral
        y_c - third y value of a quadrilateral
        x_d - fourth x value of a quadrilateral
        y_d - fourth y value of a quadrilateral

      • equal

        public java.lang.Boolean equal(double x1,
                               double y1,
                               double x2,
                               double y2,
                               double x3,
                               double y3,
                               double x4,
                               double y4)
        Method to test if two lines are the same length

        The distance between two points is the length of a line, so if this distance is the same as the other set of points, the lines are the same length

        Parameters:
        x1 - contains the x value of the first point
        y1 - contains the y value of the first point
        x2 - contains the x value of the second point
        y2 - contains the y value of the second point
        x3 - contains the x value of the third point
        y3 - contains the y value of the third point
        x4 - contains the x value of the fourth point
        y4 - contains the y value of the fourth point
        Returns:
        "true" if the two lines are the same length

        yc - contains the y value of the third point
        xd - contains the x value of the fourth point
        yd - contains the y value of the fourth point

        xb - contains the x value of the second point
        yb - contains the y value of the second point

      • areaQuad

        public java.lang.Double areaQuad(double xa,
                                 double ya,
                                 double xb,
                                 double yb,
                                 double xc,
                                 double yc,
                                 double xd,
                                 double yd)
        Method to calculate the area of a quadrilateral

        Heron's formula is used to calculate the area of two triangles in the quadrilateral. The area is the sum of these calculations.

        Parameters:
        xa - contains the x value of the first point
        ya - contains the y value of the first point
        xb - contains the x value of the second point
        yb - contains the y value of the second point
        xc - contains the x value of the third point
        yc - contains the y value of the third point
        xd - contains the x value of the fourth point
        yd - contains the y value of the fourth point
        Returns:
        the area of the quadrilateral

      • print

        public void print()
        Method to print the data of a quadrilateral

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main class to make a Quadrilateral an object

        "This class makes two files: 1."Quadrilateral_Type" is used to store data for pre-entered cords."+'\n'+"2."Quadrilateral_Cords" contains coordinates that are read and outputted into the terminal."

        Parameters:
        args - makes a Quadrilateral an object
